page.title: 06BURGHFIELD-HENRY WILLINK
page.content: The Willink School is named after HENRY GEORGE WILLINK (1851-1938), lawyer,traveller,mountaineer,who lived in the area.Born in Liverpool and educated at Eton and Oxford,Willink settled in Burghfield in 1890,becoming chairman of Bradfield District Council and a County Councillor and Alderman. Willink was interested in education and was chairman of the local educa- tion committee and vice-president of Reading University Council. The land on which the school was built in the 1950s was given to the education committee by Major Dent,a relative of Willink's wife.Complaints from a lady at Boldrewood (a large house-now demolished) led to the school being built on the far side of the field from the village.Mrs Bland's Infants School shares the same plot of land.
